{{infobox character | people=[[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] | name=Axantur | image= | caption= | pronun=[[Quenya|Q]], {{IPA|[akˈsantur]}} | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Númenor]] | affiliation= | language=[[Adûnaic]] and [[Sindarin]] | birth={{SA|395}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death=unknown (aged 180+) | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house=[[House of Elros]] | parentage=[[Nolondil]] | siblings=[[Yávien]] and [[Oromendil]] | spouse= | children=[[Lindissë]], [[Ardamir (son of Axantur)|Ardamir]] and [[Cemendur (son of Axantur)|Cemendur]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Axantur''' was the third child of [[Nolondil]], a member of the royal line of [[Númenor]]. His cousin was [[Tar-Elendil]], the fourth [[King of Númenor]]. We know almost nothing of Axantur's life, but his descendants would return to the royal family: his great-grandson [[Hallacar]] married [[Tar-Ancalimë]], the first [[Ruling Queen of Númenor|Ruling Queen]].{{UT|earlier}} ==Etymology== ''Axantur'' is a [[Quenya]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Stracks suggests it means "Master of Law", being a combination of ''[[axan]]'' ("law, rule, commandment") + ''[[tur]]'' ("master, lord").{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-874515811.html|articlename=Q.
